intro: Galium gracilentum, commonly known as slender bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers during the summer months. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium gracilentum is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in temperate regions of North America.
